intro: Cyphia brachyandra, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cyphia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It is often found in fynbos vegetation, which is a unique ecosystem in the region. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it requires specific care to thrive.
